title: Apple, Ford, Jowell, Carnival: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Apple and Tesla were building on their strong starts to the year; Jowell Global shares extended their decline premarket
text:
* Tesla meanwhile was wavering, down 0.3% premarket. On Monday the stock notched a strong start to 2022 on the heels of reporting that its deliveries of vehicles surged last year.

* Ford Motor shares added 3.1%. The car maker said Tuesday it has doubled its goal for manufacturing its new electric version of the F-150 pickup truck, targeting 150,000 per year.

* Shares of Chinese e-commerce company Jowell Global dropped 3.6% premarket, adding to Monday's loss when the stock closed down 59%.

* Pfizer shares edged down 0.4% premarket. U.S. health regulators cleared use of a Covid-19 booster from Pfizer and BioNTech in adolescents 12 to 15 years old, expanding access to an extra dose that could bolster the fight against the Omicron variant. Novavax shares slipped 1.7% and Moderna shed 0.8%.

* Carnival shares gained 2.3% premarket, just days after the CDC recommended all Americans avoid cruise ships, even if they are vaccinated. Royal Caribbean was also up, by 1.5%.

* AT&T gained 0.6% premarket and Verizon added 0.3%. The telecom companies said they agreed to delay their rollout of a new 5G service for two weeks, reversing course after previously declining a request by U.S. transportation officials.

* MillerKnoll and Smart Global Holdings are among the companies reporting earnings Tuesday.

Chart of the Day

* Large lenders in Australia and Spain are offering customers cryptocurrency assets for the first time.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Apple, Ford, Jowell, Carnival: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
